pull.title: ci: run unit + functional tests on all ancestor commits
pull.body:
### Problem

Other CI jobs fully test only the most recent 7 commits in a PR (the PR tip by most jobs + `test-each-commit` checking a limited number of ancestor commits), so failures introduced deeper in the commit stack might be missed.

### Fix

Split per-commit testing into two jobs that cover **every non-head PR commit** (no max-count limit), while keeping the PR tip excluded because it is already covered by the normal CI jobs:

- **Unit tests on all ancestor commits (Ubuntu)**: compile + run all unit tests (ctest) for each commit, skipping functional tests - this will fail fast on early commit failures for example.
- **Functional tests on all ancestor commits (Cirrus, max timeout)**: compile + run functional tests for each commit, skipping unit tests, and pass `--failfast` to stop after the first failure.

Both jobs reuse the existing per-commit `git rebase --exec` approach and the existing `ci-test-each-commit-exec.py` - now configurable via flags.

### Examples

* Example failure 10 commits deep:
https://github.com/l0rinc/bitcoin/actions/runs/21290002378/job/61280792972?pr=105 and https://github.com/l0rinc/bitcoin/actions/runs/21290002378/job/61284299949?pr=105

* Example pass with >7 commits:
https://github.com/l0rinc/bitcoin/actions/runs/21290024115/job/61280866773?pr=106#step:8:2800

<details>
<summary>Note</summary>

The failure above was generated with a few extra dummy commits, see:
https://github.com/l0rinc/bitcoin/pull/105/commits and https://github.com/l0rinc/bitcoin/pull/106/commits

</details>

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34383.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->
ðŸš§ At least one of the CI tasks failed.
<sub>Task `lint`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/21265870531/job/61204792016</sub>
<sub>LLM reason (âœ¨ experimental): Lint failure: a file is not executable (ci-compile-each-commit-exec.py has 644 permission).</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

> ci-test-each-commit-exec.py

unrelated note: I think this script is missing the functional test runner `--failfast` option. A failure will lead to a massive log output with all failures collected, which is hard to read and debug. It would be better to just print the first failure.

More generally, I wonder if it wouldn't be easier to just run it on all commits. I guess the timeout could be raised to the max (6 hours), possibly using a cirrus runner.

If a pull request doesn't finish after 6 hours on a 16 core machine, then it is probably too large and should be split up?

If it isn't possible to split up, one or two reviewers can run the script locally?

verification.payload:
tree 6de47a8985aa64149ce647d716eb42d9053df639
parent 5b8c204275aa1335fe9c336a2bd1d397b49a8ac6
author LÅ‘rinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1769178448 +0100
committer LÅ‘rinc <pap.lorinc@gmail.com> 1769187980 +0100

ci: run per-commit unit and functional tests

Run unit tests on every non-head pull request commit.

Add a Cirrus job that runs functional tests on every non-head pull request commit.

Make `ci-test-each-commit-exec.py` configurable to skip unit or functional tests and optionally pass `--failfast`.

Co-authored-by: MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz>

events.body: Thanks @maflcko, split the previous `test-each-commit` into two, updated PR title&description (kept old branch name though).
